intro: Pavetta deflersii, commonly known as the Florida pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as hammocks and wetlands. Its small, white to pale blue flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in the spring. Pavetta deflersii has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, black berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful.
